item.description:
Let's go and learn about one of our greatest presidents within the last 50 years. JFK. We will tour the museum and take in some history of the 60's.

Here's a little about the museum:

The John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum is dedicated to the memory of our nation's thirty-fifth president and to all those who through the art of politics seek a new and better world.Located on a ten-acre park, overlooking the sea that he loved and the city that launched him to greatness, the Library stands as a vibrant tribute to the life and times of John F. Kennedy.Come tour our Museum which portrays the life, leadership, and legacy of President Kennedy, conveys his enthusiasm for politics and public service, and illustrates the nature of the office of the President.

Check out the website: http://www.jfklibrary.org/

We are going to have a self guided tour on own. Admission is $12 but you can pick up library passes for $5.00 a piece for 2 people. Check your local library.

T accessible: The Library and Museum is easily accessed by public transportation. Take the MBTA Rapid Transit, Red Line (any red line train) to JFK/UMASS Station. There is a free shuttle bus to the Library every 20 minutes beginning at 8:00 a.m. and running until Museum closing. Please take the buses marked ‘JFK.’

Driving in: For those using a GPS device for locating the Library and Museum, please use the following street address (note: this is not the Library's street address): 220 Morrissey Boulevard, Boston, MA 02125 Free parking.

 

Heavy rain/snow cancels this event.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the front lobby area
item.name: JFK Library and Museum
